text:
When presenting a dialog to request authorization for an oauth2 client, a user can choose to not grant authorization. I would like to let the requesting oauth2 client know that the user clicked on 'denied' by redirecting to the callback with an `access_denied` error. Is there a way to do this?

Right now, I manually construct a `Request`, throw an `AccessDenied` error, and use it to construct the redirect URI, but this is ugly.
title: Let OAuth2 client know when user denies access

text: This is ugly.  We should have a hook for this so people can run their own code/display their own page when this happens.
